entry.title: Embriachi workshop (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that around 1400, the Embriachi workshop in northern Italy specialised in marriage caskets with carved bone plaques (example pictured)?

entry.title: David Glenn Lewis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after David Glenn Lewis was killed in an apparent hit-and-run incident 30 years ago today 1,600 miles (2,600 km) from his home, it took a Google search in 2004 to identify his body?

entry.title: a Florida TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the launch of a Florida TV station was brought forward nearly two months because the local ABC affiliate stopped airing more than half of its prime-time shows?

entry.title: Manuel María Gálvez Egúsquiza (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Peruvian foreign minister Manuel María Gálvez Egúsquiza was arrested by Chilean troops for refusing to sign peace with the cession of territory during the War of the Pacific?

entry.title: Academy Fight Song (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rolling Stone named Mission of Burma's "Academy Fight Song" as one of the 100 greatest debut singles of all time?

entry.title: Allan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the first issue of Allan, one of the earliest Japanese magazines focused on male–male romance for a female audience, featured a pin-up poster of David Bowie?

entry.title: Banu Kalb (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Banu Kalb tribe were originally Christians but became Muslims after the Muslim conquest of the Levant?

entry.title: donutussy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a donut has a donutussy?
